newsitem.title: GERMANY: NordLB says 1996 pre-tax profit rose slightly.
newsitem.headline: NordLB says 1996 pre-tax profit rose slightly.

text.p: Norddeutsche Landesbank (NordLB), a publicly-owned German regional bank, said on Monday its pre-tax profit rose slightly in 1996 to around 807 million marks ($487.6 million) from 803.5 million.
The figure was announced by NordLB chairman Manfred Bodin at the opening of the bank's new trading premises in Hanover.

NordLB had said in December that it expected operating profit after risk provisions to fall 10 percent to about 400 million marks in 1996 due to costs associated with heavy investment in electronic data processing systems.

However Bodin said moves to centralise trading activities at the new premises and streamline investment banking activities into three key areas -- sales, trading and own-account trading -- should improve results in this area by some 50 million marks this year.
The bank is due to release definitive results in March.
